headline.main: NATURE AIDS DEFENSE OF AUSTRALIA; Invaders Would Face Many Perils by Sea Or Overland

lead_paragraph: From some point in the Eastern coastal belt of Australia General MacArthur looks at maps and surveys his problem of "organizing an American offensive against Japan" from the base of Australia. But before the offensive can begin material must be accumulated and the base secured against attack.
abstract: U S troop camp, Australia, illus
